discussion.content: routed directly under the rolling chair and has been smashed flat over time. Excessive collisions
i dont get this question at all. they talk about the workstation receiving no network connectivity but then talk about the VOIP phone having a flattened patch cable.

shouldn't it be "Split Pairs" ? 

"A split pair is a wiring error where two wires of a twisted pair are instead connected using two wires from different pairs, potentially creating interference."

"Excessive Collisions:
This means that if an interface fails to allocate a slot in which it can transmit its frame without another collision 16 times, it gives up. The frame is simply not transmitted, and is marked as an excessive collision."

Excessive collisions might be related with not finding a slot to transmit the frame. Not with the "Physical collisions" of the chair with the cable. I think they are playing here with "collisions" word

comments.content: Yes, crosstalk is electromagnetic interference between wires on the same UTP cable. This is avoided using twisted pairs. When the wires stop being twisted (flattened, as in the question), crosstalk happens and can completely degrade the signal.
Nah, crosstalk is caused by electric interference.

questions.question_text:
A technician receives a report that a user's workstation is experiencing no network connectivity. The technician investigates and notices the patch cable running the back of the user's VoIP phone is routed directly under the rolling chair and has been smashed flat over time.
Which of the following is the most likely cause of this issue?

A project lead is reviewing the statement of work for an upcoming project that is focused on identifying potential weaknesses in the organization's internal and external network infrastructure. As part of the project, a team of external contractors will attempt to employ various attacks against the organization. The statement of work specifically addresses the utilization of an automated tool to probe network resources in an attempt to develop logical diagrams indication weaknesses in the infrastructure.
The scope of activity as described in the statement of work is an example of:

discussion.content: keyword is "employ various attacks" so it's definitely a Penetration testing
Various attacks means pen testing as contractors have been employed to do this.
What they are describing is vuln scanning.

comments.content: Yep, they are also doing vuln scanning. But this specific line "As part of the project, a team of external contractors will attempt to employ various attacks against the organization", is a giveaway that this is pen test. You do not try to employ various attacks during vuln scanning. You'll get a red flag if you did this.

I want to agree with you on this, but they are specifically pointing towards the "scope of activity described in the SOW", and that is so very clearly vulnerability scanning... . Sounds like one of 'em trick questions... .

discussion.content: Internet settings were set to redirect all traffic through an unknown proxy Is MITM

questions.question_text: A technician recently fixed a computer with several viruses and spyware programs on it and notices the Internet settings were set to redirect all traffic through an unknown proxy. This type of attack is known as which of the following?

choices.B: The communication should be limited to security staff only.
choices.D: The communication should be limited to management only.
choices.A: The communication should be limited to trusted parties only.
choices.C: The communication should come from law enforcement.

questions.question_text: Which of the following principles describes how a security analyst should communicate during an incident?

discussion.content: The Answer is A - Trusted parties

comments.content: No, because that would exclude other stakeholders (legal, HR, etc.. ). The answer is A, which includes relevant stakeholders.

questions.question_text: Management is concerned with administrator access from outside the network to a key server in the company. Specifically, firewall rules allow access to the server from anywhere in the company. Which of the following would be an effective solution?

discussion.content: jump server, jump host or jump box is a system on a network used to access and manage devices in a separate security zone. A jump server is a hardened
A jump box is a secure computer that all admins first connect to before launching any administrative task or use as an origination point to connect to other servers or untrusted environments

A jump server, jump host or jump box is a system on a network used to access and manage devices in a separate security zone. A jump server is a hardened and monitored device that spans two dissimilar security zones and provides a controlled means of access between them.
